page.title: 05NW EDGE - CONTINUED
page.content: Alongside Tewkesbury Road are a group of older,individual properties while a high density, brick built "first time buyers"{housing}estate spreads out along Heyden Lane. The River Chelt supports a row of residential caravans and itinerant scrap dealers. An{industrial}park near Swindon Farm has a bronze foundry and hydraulic lift gear-making and car distribution centre. In total about 350 employed, turnover Â£9,000,000. About 60 other companies using mainly {aluminium}and steel, many operating in under 1000 sq. metres, employ 2,500 workers. The United Kingdom and West Europe, using road transport, supply raw materials to Kingsditch Industrial Estate and receive finished products in exchange. Local residents resent industrial presence but its monetary contribution aids area's conservation.
